item.title: Project 1
item.description: library(tidyverse) #installs the library tidyverse library(readxl) #Assigns the datasets to a variable to read the dataset l_expect<-read_csv("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Abhi-Gan/SDS-Project-1/main/Life_expectancy_at_birth.csv") govt_expend<-read_csv("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Abhi-Gan/SDS-Project-1/main/total-government-expenditure-on-education-gdp.csv") pop_and_gdp<-read_csv("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Abhi-Gan/SDS-Project-1/main/Correct_Population_and_GDP_by_Country.csv") #JOINING THE DATASETS life_and_edu<-inner_join(l_expect, govt_expend,by = c("Period" = "Year","Location"="Entity")) #merges two datasets and assigns them to a variable inc_gdp_edu<- life_and_edu %>% inner_join(pop_and_gdp,by = c("Period" = "Time","Location" = "Country Name")) #merges all three datasets and assigns them to a variable final_dataset<-inc_gdp_edu %>% # sets to a variable called final_dataset filter(Indicator == "Life expectancy at birth (years)")%>% select("Location","Period","Value","Government expenditure on education, total (% of GDP)", "GDP (current US$) [NY.

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.
